meanings.definition: To form a mental image or idea
meanings.sent1: She enjoys conceiting stories in her mind before bedtime.
meanings.sent2: When I close my eyes, I start conceiting what my dream house would look like.
meanings.sent3: While conceiting a plan to surprise her friend, she accidentally spilled the secret.
meanings.sent4: His mind was conceiting a beautiful landscape filled with colorful flowers.
meanings.sent5: Conceiting a solution to the puzzle, she finally understood how to solve it.

meanings.definition: To have an excessively high opinion of oneself
meanings.sent1: He is always conceiting that he is the best player on the team.
meanings.sent2: She keeps conceiting that she is the most talented artist in the class.
meanings.sent3: Despite his constant conceiting, his friends still appreciate his humility.
meanings.sent4: Her conceiting attitude made it challenging for others to work with her.
meanings.sent5: Conceiting her abilities beyond measure, she often overlooked the efforts of others.
